title.rendered: Demonstration Alert – U.S. Embassy Accra, Ghana (April 13, 2018)

content.rendered:
Demonstration Alert – U. S. Embassy Accra, Ghana (April 13, 2018)

Location 1 (April 17, 2018): Town center, south of the Kumasi Central Market, concluding in the Aboabo neighborhood of Kumasi, Ghana

Event 1: Ongoing demonstrations are expected to take place on April 17, 2018, beginning around 0700 and concluding around 1200 in the town center of Kumasi. The Ashanti Youth Organization intends to demonstrate against the Defense Cooperation Agreement (DCA) between the Government of Ghana and the United States.

Location 2 (April 18, 2018): Town center, near Jubilee Park and the Central Market in Tamale, Ghana

Event 2: Ongoing demonstrations are expected to take place on April 18, 2018, beginning around 0800 around Jubilee Park and Central Market in Tamale. The Arise Ghana Youth Movement intends to demonstrate against the Defense Cooperation Agreement (DCA) between the Government of Ghana and the United States.

Actions to Take:

  • Avoid the areas of the demonstrations.
  • Avoid crowds.
  • Exercise caution if unexpectedly in the vicinity of large gatherings or protests.
  • Be aware of your surroundings.
  • Monitor local media for updates.
  • Keep a low profile.

Assistance:
U.S. Embassy Accra, Ghana
+(233) 30-27-41-000
+(233) 30-27-41-000 (after hours)
ACSAccra@state.gov

https://gh.usembassy.gov/

 

State Department – Consular Affairs
888-407-4747 or 202-501-4444

Country Information for Ghana

 

  • Enroll in the Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP) to receive security updates
  • Follow us on Twitter and Facebook.
